dublinCore.dc:title: 119 HR 1952 IH: Future Funding for Agricultural Research, Mentorship, and Education Reauthorization Act
dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.

action.action-desc: Mr. Riley of New York (for himself and Mr. Feenstra) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Agriculture

form.official-title: To amend the National Agricultural Research, Extension, and Teaching Policy Act of 1977 to extend grants and fellowships for food and agricultural sciences education.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Future Funding for Agricultural Research, Mentorship, and Education Reauthorization Act or the Future FARMER Act.

section.header: Extension of grants and fellowships for food and agricultural sciences education
section.text: Section 1417(m) of the National Agricultural Research, Extension, and Teaching Policy Act of 1977 (7 U.S.C. 3152(m)) is amendedâ€”

paragraph.text: in paragraph (1), by striking and at the end;
in paragraph (2), by striking the period at the end and adding ; and; and
by adding at the end the following:
$40,000,000 for each of fiscal years 2025 through 2029.
